details.description: You must tell DVLA if you suffer from ankylosing spondylitis and it affects your ability to drive safely - download the correct form to let them know
details.body:
You must tell DVLA if ankylosing spondylitis affects your ability to drive safely.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

If you’re not sure if ankylosing spondylitis affects your ability to drive safely, check with your doctor or consultant.

If it does, you must tell DVLA. Fill in form G1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘G1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 289KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

If you’re not sure if ankylosing spondylitis affects your ability to drive safely, check with your doctor or consultant.

If it does, you must tell DVLA. Fill in form G1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘G1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 326KB)
